subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} - pictographic representation of a bow.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
Possibly related to {{cog|tbq-pro|*kuːŋ||tree, branch, stem}} ({{zh-ref|Coblin, 1986}}), semantically connected with the shape of a bent tree branch. Cognate with {{cog|my|ကိုင်||to bend over; to be bent}}, {{m|my|အကိုင်||stalk; branch}}, {{cog|ctd|tr=kung¹|t=tree}}, {{cog|kac|kung||to branch; to grow}}, {{m|kac|lakung|la'''kung'''|branch; limb}}, {{cog|lep|tr=kóng|t=branch}}, {{m|lep|tr=kúng|t=tree}} (STEDT).

{{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}} proposes that both {{cog|och|-}} {{och-l|弓}} and {{cog|tbq-pro|*kuːŋ}} are derived from {{bor|zh|mkh-pro|*koŋ}}, whence {{cog|cbn|tr=kóoŋ|t=bent (in the middle)}}, {{cog|mnw|ကိုၚ်||to be bent}}, {{cog|km|កោង||to bend; to be bent}}, {{cog|kha|pyrkhung||to bend; to arch}}, {{cog|pcb|kuŋ||bend}}, {{cog|vi|cong||to be bent, curved}}.

Also compare {{cog|tbq-pro|*ku(ː)m||arched; vaulted}}

Derivatives are {{och-l|肱|(upper) arm}} and {{och-l|穹|arched; vault; sky}}.
